text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the distinction between admissibility and jurisdiction by framing the entire analysis around jurisdictional prerequisites (Consent, Connection, Applicable Law). It discusses how a counterclaim might be procedurally allowed (e.g., under UNCITRAL Rules Art. 21(3)) but still fall outside the tribunal's jurisdiction *ratione materiae* due to lack of consent in the underlying treaty, which is the core of the criterion. The discussion of set-off vs. affirmative counterclaims also touches upon procedural vs. substantive acceptance.", "criterion_id": "5bd9c5b8-913d-4e37-8ca4-67a98f63820c"}
